title: 188-C
statement: C. LCMtime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutLeast common multiple (LCM) of two numbers is the smallest positive integer which is divisible by both of them. You are given integersaandb. Calculate their LCM.InputThe input contains two integersaandb(1 ≤a,b≤ 103), separated by a single space.OutputOutput LCM(a,b).ExamplesInput10 42Output210Input123 41Output123

processed.result:
You are given two integers $a$ and $b$. Calculate the least common multiple (LCM) of $a$ and $b$. 

The LCM is the smallest positive integer that is divisible by both $a$ and $b$.
Given two numbers, find the smallest number that is a multiple of both.
